Love that they have Mocktails and Cocktails so you have selection. Recommend you all check it out won't be disappointed.

I also like that there no surcharge for using a credit card as so many places do now. I hate that and feel that if you need the money raise your price. Many places add the surcharge so the cover the card fee or get cash the they may or may not report.

Reviews.Review: I live in the city and love dining at Industry Kitchen! You cannot beat the location with beautiful views of the East River, Brooklyn etc. The staff is so welcoming and the service is always fantastic. Special shout out to Catherine, Nyla, Jonas and Salesta, who always make me feel like family whenever I dine here. This time around, my friend and I both ordered the Fattoush Salad (mine w/salmon - cooked perfectly - raw the way I like it and my friend had shrimp added to her salad and she loved it). This restaurant is easily accessible by the East River ferry to the Wall Street/Pier 11 stop and is only a few steps away. Highly recommend if you're in the area. I'll definitely be back!

The restaurant staff seemed to be used to it and barely did anything. I completely understand that NYC has a rat issue but I never witnessed anything even close to seeing so many in the open while dining.

We were seated by I guess a large item that may be outdoors sometimes that is covered by clothes. There are FLIES alot of FLIES one literally died mid air during our meal and landed on the table. I want to say again the SERVICE is great! The manager with the blonde hair came by and checked in, the people are friendly … Drinks were on point too. Just be aware that there are flies and the inside doesn't give $2,000 pizza vibes. If you sit outside everything will be fine.

Reviews.Review: The pizza that two of us had was delicious as always. But I was excited to try the vegan omelette and happy to see a new plant-based choice on the menu. Ugh, I should have stuck with pizza. Unfortunately it was absolutely inedible and the manager of such a big and popular restaurant should be embarrassed to serve such unappetizing slop to valued customers. It was powdery, watery yellow slop with about a tablespoon of vegetables inside. I picked out the filling, ate the salad and shared my son’s pizza. I should have said something but I didn’t. I feel bad that I wasted over $20 for that crap, and left hungry. That “omelette” should be taken off the menu until the chef actually figures out how to prepare a vegan omelette. May I suggest a tofu scramble or chickpea flour omelette instead? There are a lot of good recipes out there for them. And actually make sure it’s edible before insulting good-paying customers with slop.

Reviews.Review: We have been to Industry Kitchen many times and we like the food and location. But there were a few things that annoyed me last night. I made a simple request to make my pizza half margarita and half another kind on the menu. Every pizza place I’ve been to is able to do this, but the chef refused. “We can’t do that” they said. Why not if that’s what the customer wants? So I had to change my request and ask for ricotta cheese as a topping on my margarita. I got about a teaspoon of ricotta per slice, so skimpy, and was charged extra for that. In terms of comfort, it got very chilly when the sun went down, and there were no heat lamps. I was so cold I couldn’t wait to get the check and leave. I understand this place is more expensive because of the ambiance of sitting near the water and it is NYC, but all my son and I ordered were two personal pizzas, and a glass of mocktail punch for him (I drank water), and the bill was $77. A bit outrageous, especially since I was uncomfortably cold and couldn’t get what I wanted. We go occasionally because it’s a great view of the harbor and the food tastes good, but there is definitely room for improvement. The chef needs to be less rigid and stingy, and they should invest in some heat lamps to make customers more comfortable while enjoying the view, or at least leave their igloos up until the end of May.

Reviews.Review: My cousin and I had dinner here last night and our experience was fantastic from start to finish. We sat outside in one of the cute huts (heated and so comfortable) with a beautiful view of the Hudson River. We ordered the grilled Atlantic salmon and the fattoush salad with salmon. My cousin and I ended up swapping our meals in the middle and suffice it to say, we both thoroughly enjoyed both entrees. My salmon was cooked to perfection (I like it rare). I also ordered a Downeast Cider which was delish! I was greeted by Ishaeb when I arrived who was so chill and welcoming. Ditto re: Salesta too. Our server Merlin was outstanding - attentive, efficient and friendly. Kudos to the hiring manager! I highly recommend Industry Kitchen. The food was delicious, the ambiance was perfect and the service was fantastic. The staff really epitomize what exemplary customer service is all about!

Reviews.Review: It is very rare that I write a review as my family is heavily involved in the metro area restaurant business and I understand all of the challenges that restaurants are faced with however this experience left me feeling remorse for the $200 spent that I would have preferred to donate. We were told four things that we tried to order were out of stock and then spied someone at a nearby table who arrived after us eating one of them. We would have indulged in 3-4 cocktails each but my husband canceled his second drink after 40 minutes and not being able to attract any attention. The main course was piled on top of the appetizer plates. We could not track anyone down to provide more water. The lemondate my girls ordered was all ice. I could go on for hours. If the garage we parked in had been open later I would have hunted down a manager but given that we were trying to have a festive day downtown (we live on the UES) and the insane disappointment and disgust with our meals and service, the only thing I wanted to do was leave. I will not apologize for this being harsh. We eat out 4 nights a week ranging from Michelin star to local establishments, and this was just a regret.

Visited Industry Kitchen on 11/23/23 for Thanksgiving dinner. Reservation was at 7pm and we had all traveled from Los Angeles in hopes of being near the water and having a great dinner. Unfortunately, when we arrived we were sat down and then told that there was no longer any Thanksgiving dinner options or plates. We were told that there was a limit of 250 plates, which was never stated in their website or flyers that were posted online and in person. The waiter told us they ran out of everything, including turkey and mashed potatoes. We were inclined to order from the regular menu. Some individuals in our group ordered steak with a baked potato. The waiter returned 5 minutes later and told 2 individuals that they had ran out of baked potatoes and given the option of substituting with french fries (truffle fries). This was very disappointing. I gave the waiter the idea of adding mashed potatoes to the dish instead of french fries with the steak, which they were finally able to do. Overall very disappointing and overcharged for the small portions of food.

Took my husband here for his birthday and I can’t recommend it enough. Of course the atmosphere is beautiful, with the enclosed clear outdoor table and incredible waterside view, but the service was what made it amazing. I made the reservation on OpenTable and just clicked the birthday special occasion, but didn’t add any notes or special requests. Upon arriving the hotesses greeted my husband with Happy Birthday and they gave us an incredible table of our choice. Our server, Eddie was so attentive and intentional and always checked to make sure we had everything we needed. The manager even stopped by to check on us too! We will absolutely be back and will be telling all of our friends about this gem!

Reviews.Review: Industry Kitchen was recommended by Venetta at Hilton DoubleTree on Stone Street in the financial district. Their front desk personnel double as concierges. I hope they get double the pay! We had a wonderful view of the pier! The food was absolutely delicious! Being from the South, we thought everything in NY restaurants was overpriced. We had the delicious Northern Italian soup, the grilled salmon with the vegetables, and the burrata was delish! Our server was a little confused or overwhelmed- not sure, but he was not efficient. A female server came to our rescue, apologized and took our order. She had a great attitude and cheerful disposition. If we're back in NY again, this will be a deliciously reliable place.

I was charged ahead of time which isn't a problem but for a lunch meeting the dollar amount of $80 per person is excessive. I don't mind paying for what we order but people weren't drinking and to spend $80 for a meal is too high. I feel $50 would be sufficient and still on the high side. There was over $200 that I paid that was for nothing. People took food to go and we ordered apps and meals and still didn't meet the required amount. Our server was excellent. I will not book a large group there again. Thank you.

Reviews.Review: The food was good and the ambiance was nice. However, our waitress completely abandoned us. There was another event happening at the restaurant. She was busy with that and I understand, however, the whole service was rushed. When it was finally time for us to pay for our meal, she was nowhere to be found. When we were ready for her to take the payment, we saw that she was busy with the event, but she would walk by our table, avoided eye contact and act like she didn’t see us waiting for her. It was to the point where we had to signal other waiters. I had to get up from my seat to look for other waiters and ask them to give us our checks and to take it when we were ready. The waiters had to look for her for us twice. Like I said, I understand that she had a lot on her plate, but they could’ve at least assigned our table another waiter/waitress. It was just terrible service overall. Never experienced something like that before honestly; so disappointing.

Reviews.Review: I love Industry Kitchen. The vibe is always great and you can somehow always get a table. Food is great. The lamb chops with goat cheese and fig jam are insane! Even their vegan pizza options are great. Watermelon arugula salad with salmon is bomb. Drinks are always on point and the view sets this spot apart from other indoor/outdoor spots. The only thing I’d say could use just a bit of improvement is the brunch menu. Most items could use a bit more pizazz in flavor. But that’s literally the only thing and it’s not a big deal honestly. Oh and ask to be seated in Eman’s section. Eman is the absolute best! Make your reservation today. You’ll love it!

Reviews.Review: Industry Kitchen is perfectly located at the water's edge of the East River. It's a casual, very energetic, environment. I had the Lobster Cobb Salad, which was delicious, however, at $30 for a salad, I would expect a good portion of lump lobster meat as if it came from a good-sized lobster tail. Instead, I received tiny pieces of lobster meat scattered on the salad. Very disappointing. I asked the waitress to recommend a draft beer because I'm a Heineken drinker and it wasn't an option, so she pointed out the first draft beer listed and I don't recall the name. It was delicious, went perfectly with my salad, and was unlike the bite of Heineken. As the meal progressed, the music volume was vastly elevated making a conversation a bit challenging. Overall, this is an excellent spot for meeting up with friends.

I really wanted to love this place, but the food fell short. We started off with the meatballs and crab cake. Meatballs were excellent until I bit into one and felt a hard block, looked like a pit of some sort. Crab cake was definitely microwaved, but the aioli had a great flavor. Drinks were okay. The cosmopolitan I ordered had proseco in it, I’m not sure why, and the second round I could taste espresso in the glass so they served it in a dirty glass with espresso still in it from their espresso cocktail that can be found on the menu. My husband had the Ceaser salad, which was great. I had the lobster omelette which lacked flavor and was luke warm. Ambiance is beautiful. Really lovely view. We would try it again.

Reviews.Review: Loved sitting in the tiny houses outside with friend

Food was just okay. But the Beurremont Burrata was exceptional. Chocolate mousse was served in four tiny chocolate 'cups', and each had whipped cream--they were also sitting in a very small amount of whipped cream (which kind of melted and therefore didn't look intentional but more like they were trying to cover up a spill. It was a nice idea, but for me there was way too much whipped cream and not enough mousse at all. Also, when I ordered a latte, it came in a glass cup, and the coffee seemed very weak. We liked our server a lot, but he never was around. I always had to ask someone else to tell him we wanted to order, or we were ready for the dessert menu, or the check, etc. (btw, the place was only half full) When we left, we had to actually interrupt a group of servers (who were just standing around talking) just to get out of the restaurant. There was a very odd element to this place. A professional photographer was roaming around the place asking to take pictures of the customers. One family with small children next to us agreed. But I didn't really like the intrusion on our lunch. The place itself is so gorgeous. So beautiful, and the view of the water is great. The only big problem is that you have to endure the smell of diesel from the boats, which is a big deterrent. All in all, it's not a terrible place, but it's not great either.

Reviews.Review: First night in New York and thought we would try this place as it was close to our hotel. Overall, it was just poor to ok. We ordered the truffle potato twists as an appetizer which came out cold. The margarita pizza barely had any cheese on it (for the style of a margarita). They messed up another pizza (added sausage to it when we didn’t order it) and ultimately had to pay for another pizza to replace it. Server was not attentive at all. It was downright annoying… we had to literally wave our hands and flag him down several times for soda refills for our kids even though the place was not crowded. No ranch dressing at all for pizza, small thing but really no ranch dressing in the entire restaurant??? Food was prepared fast, which was a plus. Nice location and very nice holiday decorations but as far as ambience, the loud music was out of balance relative to the amount of people in the restaurant which in my opinion killed the ambiance. Overall, didn’t get the value for the money spent and can’t say I recommend this place.

Reviews.Review: The outdoor private houses are heated and super cute for winter. Our server was absolutely amazing and the food is solid! One hostess was an absolute horror. She said there wasn’t availability around 2pm so we made a reservation (that was available on Open Table along with many other time slots) for 2:15 and told her we’d be back in 15 …. she went on to tell us that we still wouldn’t be able to sit then because there were other reservations before us? Made no sense, because the place was far from full and why would the reservation be available if it wasn’t… available? After a way too long argument which ended in her saying a dismissive “okay” and me giving up, we came back 15 mins later at 2:15 and were seated immediately and had a great experience. Would have been a 5 star review if not for this awful hostess.

Reviews.Review: This was a stunningly loud restaurant even by NYC standards, although a large private party in the bar may have made it exceptionally so on this evening. However, on request, we were readily reseated in an outside cabin, as far from the nearest loudspeaker as possible and with a clear river view. A thumbs up for good customer service. Friendly and attentive service throughout after that, too. Vegetarian members of our party spoke well of their pizzas. Carnivores were satisfied with their steaks and chops—decent value for Lower Manhattan waterfront dining.

Reviews.Review: It’s a great experience for a single diner. I went on a Saturday afternoon and had what I call The Blue Meal - Blueberry Frozé, Maryland Blue Crab Cake plate and Crème Brûlée with blueberries and strawberries. Exquisite! At my server Ish’s recommendation, the meal was just the balance I wanted in sweet and savory. Ish was very pleasant and accommodating. I had enough time to take in the view while enjoying every dab of the spicy aioli sauce that accompanied the crab cake. The crab cake! Bursting with crab!!! Lots of places give you breadcrumbs with some crab sprinkled here and there…Not Industry Kitchen. Had a great time. Will be back.

Reviews.Review: First of all, the staff and the manager were very nice. I can't say a bad word about them except to say there were not enough staff to cover all the tables so it was extremely difficult to get service. The food, on the other hand, was absolutely atrocious. I booked a table for 10 people. At least 5 of the 10 sent the food back. The "Chef" is unskilled and under qualified. We ordered pancakes. An extremely basic dish to make. The pancakes we were served were obviously pre-packaged and microwaved. Foul beyond belief! The eggs were supposed to be over-easy. They were all cooked hard. The potato curls had obviously come out of the freezer and been reheated - awful texture, equally awful flavour, dry and unappetizing. To say that I was extremely disappointed would be a gross understatement. I would certainly not recommend ANYONE to this restaurant. If you want to eat while enjoying the views I would suggest you either buy from any other of the many restaurants in the area or you pack a picnic from home and enjoy that. Do not waste your time and money here.

Reviews.Review: I've never written a bad review before but feel compelled to alert others about our experience at Industry Kitchen. Some friends and I went there to celebrate my wife's birthday. When we entered the receptionist checked us in and wished my wife a happy birthday and that was it. No further recognition. We were seated outside at a table for four. The noise level, particularly the blaring music made it almost impossible to hear each other. While waiting for one of our guests to arrive, two of us ordered iced tea. A little while later the waiter returned to tell us the iced tea 'machine' was broken. We ordered a number of small plates. Three of us tried the mussels but they literally were inedible. The waiter was told about it but did nothing. Among the other plates the ahi tuna nachos were notable for their almost total lack of tuna. What was included were literally pea size pieces of tuna surrounded by lots of cabbage, avocado, etc. The crab cake, the margarita pizza and the bianca pizza were just okay but nothing special. The wines and the tequila cocktail were fine. But everything was so disappointing that our friends insisted on going elsewhere for dessert and to celebrate the birthday.

Reviews.Review: Every time I come to Industry Kitchen I am very satisfied. The food is solid and the atmosphere is great. I have learned that the service staff is always friendly but I do tend to need to ask for things such as water or refills on cocktails. But the staff is always friendly. Caleb was super kind and friendly as well as patient. I enjoyed him. The thing that disturbed me this time was seeing the bus boys wearing gloves and touching dirty dishes, then touching my clean water bottle by the opening of the bottle. I have no idea how often the bus boys swap their gloves, but I have a feeling they don’t realize how yucky the gloves are when they are touching clean plates, bottles of water and water glasses. I would prefer to see them not wearing gloves and washing their hands more often. If they were not wearing gloves they would realize how nasty their hands are and I have a feeling would wash their hands more often, in turn keeping the guests plate-ware/ glasses/ silverware more sanitary.

Reviews.Review: In my 50 years of dining in NYC restaurants, I have never had a kinder and more thoughtful waiter. My two girlfriends and I ate out on the patio, and then talked and laughed for 4 hours. Without even ordering coffee or dessert. Our adorable waiter did not rush us out, kept bringing us fresh water and even moved our umbrella so the setting sun would not get in our eyes. The food was good and plentiful (although, I do wish there was a turkey burger on the menu!) we were comfortable and the setting just lovely. But I will NEVER forget the kindness of your staff and that waiter. Of course, we gave him a tip that was twice the cost of our meal. Well deserved !!! Doesn't happen all that much!! Warmly, Barbara Rosenberg

Reviews.Review: I had been wanting to try Industry Kitchen for some time, mostly due to its wonderful waterfront location. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the food is just as terrific as the view. My sundried tomato hummus, kale salad with shrimp and blueberry crumble were all fantastic. My server Sam was an absolute star! He was so friendly and accommodating, and made certain that my dining experience was perfect. All of the other staff members- including the hostesses and the busboys - were just as amazing. I can't wait to go back!

We were told nothing was available for us while it was raining and the restaurant was empty. Went on open table and casually got a table. The server didn’t know anything about the menu sent us the wrong food but we just didn’t say anything because it took forever. Any time we wanted another round of drinks it was a problem. I would turn to the host staff to look for help and they would stare at me knowing I needed help and wouldn’t come over. Easily the worst experience I’ve had at any restaurant in Fidi since I’ve lived here.

Reviews.Review: Our waiter Andrew was outstanding. We had a party of 11 and he didn’t skip a beat. Got every single order correct and was on top of us the whole time. Would hire this guy in a heartbeat if I had my own restaurant. The outdoor dining in the summer is perfect, can’t beat the view and the whole vibe they have going on here. The pizza was very good as were the Ahi Nachos. We also had some incredible meatballs and pizza. We didn’t like the steamed mussels them seemed very off and when I mentioned this to the staff they took them back no problem. Highly recommend this place for a get together with friends. Perfect for large parties and a great place to kick back and hang while enjoying the view.

Would eat there again, especially with out of town guests.

Reviews.Review: Everything was perfect and so romantic! We even got our picture taken for free and a complimentary postcard with the photo on it! The view and heated enclosed house with lights was all amazing. The only thing was that the food got cold fast (because it was cold out) so maybe having the food covered until it is served would be better? Nonetheless, the food tasted great and the overall experience was wonderful. Especially during COVID and wanting to be outside without freezing. I’ll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Review: Even when the restaurant business is suffering from a staff crunch, Industry Kitchen has an extraordinarily friendly and helpful team.
